intro: Glossorhyncha gibbsiae, commonly known as the Gibbs' ghost flower, is a rare and unique plant species native to the arid regions of South Africa. It is characterized by its striking, ghost-like appearance, with translucent, waxy leaves that resemble spectral forms. The plant produces delicate, pale blue flowers that bloom during the cooler months, typically in spring. Glossorhyncha gibbsiae is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, relying on succulent tissues to store water. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
